valueFormat.notes: Button visual style variant. Use enum constants STYLES.* from component

commonMistakes.mistake: Using string literal 'SOLID' instead of constant value 'solid'
commonMistakes.impact: Validator fails, falls back to default
commonMistakes.fix: Use STYLES.SOLID or literal 'solid'

valueFormat.enumReference: TYPES.PRIMARY | TYPES.SUBTLE_PRIMARY | TYPES.SECONDARY | TYPES.DANGER | TYPES.WARNING | TYPES.SMART | TYPES.SUBTLE_SMART | TYPES.INVERSE
valueFormat.notes: Button color theme. Determines background/text colors based on styling

commonMistakes.mistake: Using camelCase 'subtlePrimary' instead of kebab-case 'subtle-primary'
commonMistakes.impact: Validator fails, button shows as primary
commonMistakes.fix: Use TYPES.SUBTLE_PRIMARY or 'subtle-primary'

valueFormat.notes: Button size variant
CRITICAL: iconSize is STRING not number. '24' not 24

commonMistakes.mistake: Passing number instead of string: :icon-size="24"
commonMistakes.fix: Use string: icon-size="24" or :icon-size="'24'"

valueFormat.notes: Button text content. Shown when labelTextStatus=true

commonMistakes.mistake: Not providing labelText when labelTextStatus=true
commonMistakes.fix: Always set labelText when using the button

valueFormat.objectShape: { label: string, value: any, disabled?: boolean, icon?: string }
valueFormat.notes: Creates dropdown menu when provided. Renders InButtonGroup component
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ label: string; value: any; disabled?: boolean; icon?: string }>

commonMistakes.mistake: Expecting simple array of strings
commonMistakes.fix: Use array of objects with label and value properties

valueFormat.objectShape: { id: string, dynamicPosition: boolean, staticPosition: string, iconStatus: boolean, offset: { x: number, y: number }, preventXss: boolean }
valueFormat.default: { id: 'tooltip', dynamicPosition: false, staticPosition: 'top center', iconStatus: false, offset: { x: 4, y: 4 }, preventXss: false }
valueFormat.notes: Configuration for button tooltip
valueFormat.typescript: { id: string; dynamicPosition: boolean; staticPosition: string; iconStatus: boolean; offset: { x: number; y: number }; preventXss: boolean }

valueFormat.notes: Skeleton loader dimensions in pixels

payloadTypes.notes: Returns the clicked option from buttonGroupOptions

click.useCase: Main button click handler. Payload varies based on buttonGroupOptions presence

clickIcon.useCase: Emitted when icon is clicked (requires iconClick=true)

performanceNotes.impact: Dropdown menu re-creates on every render
performanceNotes.solution: Move buttonGroupOptions to data() or computed

accessibilityNotes.reason: Screen readers need descriptive button text

accessibilityNotes.requirement: Use disabledStatus instead of removing button
accessibilityNotes.reason: Disabled state maintains button in tab order with aria-disabled

<template>

    size="default"
    label-text="Submit"
    @click="handleSubmit" />

import { InButtonV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {

examples.title: Button with Icon and Loading State
examples.description: Button with left icon and loading indicator
examples.code:
<template>
  <InButtonV2
    id="save-btn"
    styling="solid"
    type="primary"
    left-icon="save"
    icon-size="24"
    label-text="Save Changes"
    :loading-status="isSaving"
    :disabled-status="isSaving"
    @click="handleSave" />
</template>

<script>
import { InButtonV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InButtonV2 },
  data() {
    return {
      isSaving: false
    };
  },
  methods: {
    async handleSave() {
      this.isSaving = true;
      try {
        await this.saveData();
        alert('Saved!');
      } finally {
        this.isSaving = false;
      }
    },
    async saveData() {
      return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: Button Group with Dropdown
examples.code:
<template>
  <InButtonV2
    id="export-btn"
    styling="ghost"
    type="primary"
    left-icon="export"
    label-text="Export"
    :button-group-options="exportOptions"
    @click="handleExport" />
</template>

<script>
import { InButtonV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InButtonV2 },
  data() {
    return {
      exportOptions: [
        { label: 'Export as CSV', value: 'csv', icon: 'file-csv' },
        { label: 'Export as Excel', value: 'xlsx', icon: 'file-excel' },
        { label: 'Export as PDF', value: 'pdf', icon: 'file-pdf' }
      ]
    };
  },
  methods: {
    handleExport(payload) {
      if (payload?.value) {
        console.log('Exporting as:', payload.value);
        this.performExport(payload.value);
      }
    },
    performExport(format) {
      // Export logic
    }
  }
};
</script>

valueFormat.notes: CRITICAL: V1 uses plain object, NOT array like V2. Date format depends on locale setting. Use mm/dd/yyyy for US locale, dd.mm.yyyy for EU/TR locales.

migrationToV2.notes: V2 requires array to support comparison mode

commonMistakes.mistake: Passing array format like V2: [{ startDate, endDate }]
commonMistakes.impact: Component won't render dates, shows empty picker
commonMistakes.fix: Remove array wrapper, use plain object: { startDate, endDate }

commonMistakes.mistake: Passing Date objects instead of strings
commonMistakes.fix: Convert to string: { startDate: '01/12/2024', endDate: '20/12/2024' }

commonMistakes.mistake: Wrong date format for locale (e.g., mm/dd/yyyy for Turkish locale)
commonMistakes.impact: Date parsing fails, shows invalid dates
commonMistakes.fix: Match format to locale: dd.mm.yyyy for tr-TR, mm/dd/yyyy for en-US

valueFormat.notes: CRITICAL: V1 uses object with Date array values. Keys are display labels. Values MUST be native Date objects, NOT strings.

migrationToV2.v2Format: Array<{ name: string, title: string, startDate: string, endDate: string }>
migrationToV2.transformation: Object.entries(v1CustomRanges).map(([title, dates], i) => ({ name: `custom${i+1}`, title, startDate: formatDateToSlash(dates[0]), endDate: formatDateToSlash(dates[1]) }))
migrationToV2.notes: V2 uses array with mm/dd/yyyy string format

commonMistakes.mistake: Using string dates instead of Date objects: { 'Q4': ['10/01/2024', '12/31/2024'] }
commonMistakes.impact: Component won't render custom ranges, buttons don't appear
commonMistakes.fix: Use Date objects: { 'Q4': [new Date('2024-10-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')] }

commonMistakes.mistake: Passing V2 array format with name/title properties
commonMistakes.impact: Type error, custom ranges won't work
commonMistakes.fix: Use V1 object format with Date arrays

commonMistakes.mistake: Not setting customDateRange prop to true
commonMistakes.impact: Custom ranges won't be displayed even if provided
commonMistakes.fix: Add :custom-date-range="true" to enable custom ranges

valueFormat.notes: CRITICAL: V1 uses Unix timestamps in SECONDS (not milliseconds). Array of two numbers: [start, end]. Dates in this range will be disabled.

migrationToV2.transformation: { startDate: formatDate(new Date(v1[0] * 1000)), endDate: formatDate(new Date(v1[1] * 1000)) }
migrationToV2.notes: V2 uses object with date strings

commonMistakes.mistake: Using milliseconds instead of seconds: [Date.now(), Date.now()]
commonMistakes.impact: Incorrect date range disabled, may disable dates far in future
commonMistakes.fix: Convert to seconds: [Math.floor(Date.now() / 1000), Math.floor(endDate.getTime() / 1000)]

commonMistakes.mistake: Passing Date objects or strings
commonMistakes.impact: Type error, disabled range won't work
commonMistakes.fix: Convert to Unix timestamps in seconds: [date.getTime() / 1000, ...]

commonMistakes.mistake: Using V2 object format: { startDate, endDate }
commonMistakes.impact: Type error, disabled range won't work
commonMistakes.fix: Use array of Unix timestamps: [startTimestamp, endTimestamp]

valueFormat.notes: Maps locale codes to date format strings. Must match format used in value prop. Common formats: mm/dd/yyyy (US), dd.mm.yyyy (EU/TR), dd/mm/yyyy (GB).

commonMistakes.mistake: Not providing 'default' fallback key
commonMistakes.impact: Component may not format dates correctly for unmapped locales
commonMistakes.fix: Always include 'default' key: { 'default': 'dd.mm.yyyy', ... }

commonMistakes.mistake: Format string doesn't match value prop format
commonMistakes.impact: Date parsing/display mismatch, shows wrong dates
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure formatMapping matches value date format

valueFormat.notes: Controls calendar popover position. Renamed to 'calendarPopoverAlign' in V2.
Shows extended set of quick ranges (Last 30 Days, This Month, Last Month, etc.). Replaced with more flexible 'defaultRanges' array in V2.

migrationToV2.notes: V2 uses array for granular control

commonMistakes.mistake: Expecting customRanges to show without setting customDateRange=true
commonMistakes.fix: Set both :custom-date-range="true" and provide :custom-ranges

valueFormat.notes: Enables single date selection mode. When true, only startDate is used. Renamed to 'singleDatePickerStatus' in V2.

commonMistakes.mistake: Still providing endDate when singleDatePicker=true
commonMistakes.impact: endDate is ignored, may cause confusion
commonMistakes.fix: When single mode, only set startDate in value object

update.useCase: Emitted when user selects a date range and clicks apply. V1 always returns string (no comparison support).

migrationToV2.notes: V2 can return array when comparison is active. Must check Array.isArray(payload) in V2 handler.

commonMistakes.mistake: Expecting array payload like V2
commonMistakes.impact: String.split() will fail if checking Array.isArray() first
commonMistakes.fix: V1 always returns string, no array check needed

commonMistakes.mistake: Not updating value prop reactively
commonMistakes.fix: Update startDate/endDate in data() and use computed for value

helperFunctions.name: convertToUnixTimestamp
helperFunctions.description: Convert Date object to Unix timestamp in seconds (for disabledRange)

helperFunctions.name: convertToTurkishFormat
helperFunctions.description: Convert mm/dd/yyyy to dd.mm.yyyy for Turkish locale

helperFunctions.name: convertFromTurkishFormat
helperFunctions.description: Convert dd.mm.yyyy to mm/dd/yyyy for component

performanceNotes.issue: Creating new Date objects in customRanges on every render
performanceNotes.solution: Move customRanges to data() or created() hook
performanceNotes.example: data() { return { customRanges: { 'Q4': [new Date(...), new Date(...)] } }; }

accessibilityNotes.reason: Screen readers need label for identification
Custom range buttons are announced by screen readers

migrationNotes.considerV2: InDatePicker (V1) is deprecated. Consider migrating to InDatePickerV2 for new features like comparison mode, better validation, and consistent API. Migration is medium effort but provides significant UX improvements.
breakingChanges: customRanges format: Object with Date arrays  Array with string dates
disabledRange format: Array of Unix timestamps  Object with date strings
newFeaturesInV2: Comparison mode with side-by-side date ranges

examples.title: Basic V1 Date Range Picker
examples.description: Simple date range picker without custom ranges
examples.code:
<template>
  <InDatePicker
    id="date-picker"
    label="Select Period"
    :value="dateValue"
    :min-date="minDate"
    :max-date="maxDate"
    :locale="locale"
    :format-mapping="formatMapping"
    :additional-ranges="true"
    open-position="right"
    @update="handleUpdate" />
</template>

<script>
import { InDatePicker } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InDatePicker },
  
  data() {
    return {
      startDate: '01/12/2024',
      endDate: '20/12/2024',
      minDate: '01/01/2023',
      maxDate: new Date().toLocaleDateString('en-US'),
      locale: 'en-US',
      formatMapping: {
        'en-US': 'mm/dd/yyyy',
        'tr-TR': 'dd.mm.yyyy',
        'default': 'mm/dd/yyyy'
      }
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    dateValue() {
      // V1: Plain object (NOT array)
      return {
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      };
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handleUpdate(rangeStr) {
      // V1 always returns string: "mm/dd/yyyy-mm/dd/yyyy"
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.startDate = start;
      this.endDate = end;
      
      console.log('Date range selected:', { start, end });
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: With Custom Ranges & Disabled Dates
examples.description: V1 date picker with custom quick ranges and disabled date range
examples.code:
<template>
  <InDatePicker
    id="date-picker-custom"
    label="Reporting Period"
    :value="dateValue"
    :custom-date-range="true"
    :custom-ranges="customRanges"
    :disabled-range="disabledRange"
    :additional-ranges="true"
    :locale="locale"
    :format-mapping="formatMapping"
    open-position="center"
    @update="handleUpdate" />
</template>

<script>
import { InDatePicker } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InDatePicker },
  
  data() {
    return {
      startDate: '10/01/2024',
      endDate: '12/31/2024',
      locale: 'en-US',
      formatMapping: {
        'en-US': 'mm/dd/yyyy',
        'default': 'mm/dd/yyyy'
      },
      // V1 custom ranges: Object with Date arrays
      customRanges: {
        'Q4 2024': [new Date('2024-10-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')],
        'Q3 2024': [new Date('2024-07-01'), new Date('2024-09-30')],
        'H2 2024': [new Date('2024-07-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')],
        'Full Year': [new Date('2024-01-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')]
      },
      // V1 disabled range: Unix timestamps in SECONDS
      disabledRange: [
        Math.floor(new Date('2024-12-25').getTime() / 1000), // Christmas
        Math.floor(new Date('2024-12-26').getTime() / 1000)
      ]
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    dateValue() {
      return {
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      };
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handleUpdate(rangeStr) {
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.startDate = start;
      this.endDate = end;
      
      // Update analytics or fetch data
      this.fetchReportData(start, end);
    },
    
    fetchReportData(startDate, endDate) {
      console.log('Fetching data for:', startDate, 'to', endDate);
      // API call here
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: Turkish Locale with Dot Format
examples.description: V1 date picker configured for Turkish locale with dd.mm.yyyy format
examples.code:
<template>
  <InDatePicker
    id="date-picker-tr"
    label="Tarih Aral Sein"
    :value="dateValue"
    :locale="'tr-TR'"
    :format-mapping="formatMapping"
    :additional-ranges="true"
    :custom-date-range="true"
    :custom-ranges="customRanges"
    separator=" - "
    @update="handleUpdate" />
</template>

<script>
import { InDatePicker } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InDatePicker },
  
  data() {
    return {
      startDate: '01.12.2024',
      endDate: '31.12.2024',
      formatMapping: {
        'tr-TR': 'dd.mm.yyyy',
        'default': 'dd.mm.yyyy'
      },
      customRanges: {
        'Son eyrek': [new Date('2024-10-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')],
        'Bu Yl': [new Date('2024-01-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')]
      }
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    dateValue() {
      return {
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      };
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handleUpdate(rangeStr) {
      // Note: rangeStr is still in mm/dd/yyyy format from component
      // Need to convert to dd.mm.yyyy for Turkish display
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.startDate = this.convertToTurkishFormat(start);
      this.endDate = this.convertToTurkishFormat(end);
    },
    
    convertToTurkishFormat(usDateStr) {
      // Convert mm/dd/yyyy to dd.mm.yyyy
      const [month, day, year] = usDateStr.split('/');
      return `${day}.${month}.${year}`;
    }
  }
};
</script>

valueFormat.notes: CRITICAL: Always pass an array of objects, even for single range. Second object is optional and used for comparison mode. Date format depends on locale (dd.mm.yyyy or mm/dd/yyyy).

commonMistakes.mistake: Passing value as array of strings: [startDate, endDate]
commonMistakes.impact: Component won't display selected dates, renders empty
commonMistakes.fix: Wrap in object: [{ startDate, endDate }]

commonMistakes.mistake: Not wrapping single range in array
commonMistakes.fix: Always use array: [{ startDate, endDate }]

valueFormat.structure: Array<{ name: string, title: string, startDate: string, endDate: string }>
examples: [{ name: 'custom1', title: 'Last Quarter', startDate: '09/01/2024', endDate: '11/30/2024' }, { name: 'custom2', title: 'This Year', startDate: '01/01/2024', endDate: '12/31/2024' }]
valueFormat.notes: CRITICAL: Date format MUST be mm/dd/yyyy with SLASH delimiter, regardless of locale. 'name' must be unique identifier, 'title' is display text.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ name: string; title: string; startDate: string; endDate: string }>

commonMistakes.mistake: Using 'label' property instead of 'title'
commonMistakes.impact: Range buttons won't show text labels
commonMistakes.fix: Change { label: 'Q4' } to { title: 'Q4' }

commonMistakes.mistake: Using dd.mm.yyyy or dd/mm/yyyy format
commonMistakes.fix: Use mm/dd/yyyy format: '12/31/2024' not '31.12.2024'

commonMistakes.mistake: Passing Date objects instead of strings
commonMistakes.fix: Convert to string: formatDateToSlash(new Date())

commonMistakes.mistake: Not providing unique 'name' property
commonMistakes.fix: Add unique name: { name: 'custom1', ... }

valueFormat.structure: Array<{ name: string, title: string, startDate: string, endDate: string }>
examples: [{ name: 'lastYear', title: 'Previous Period Last Year', startDate: '09/18/2024', endDate: '10/19/2024' }]
valueFormat.notes: CRITICAL: Same format as customRanges. Often calculated dynamically based on main period selection using @periodSelected event.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ name: string; title: string; startDate: string; endDate: string }>

commonMistakes.mistake: Not recalculating when main period changes
commonMistakes.fix: Watch @periodSelected event and recalculate
commonMistakes.pattern: Dynamic calculation based on selected period

valueFormat.notes: CRITICAL: Controls visibility of comparison toggle button, NOT the comparison state itself. Keep this TRUE if you want comparison feature available.

commonMistakes.mistake: Binding to reactive state: :comparison-status="isComparisonOpen"
commonMistakes.impact: Toggle button disappears when comparison is closed
commonMistakes.fix: Use static :comparison-status="true" and handle state with @openComparison/@closeComparison events

valueFormat.notes: Shows quick range buttons (Today, Yesterday, Last 7 Days, etc.). Often forgotten but crucial for UX.

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to set this to true
commonMistakes.impact: No quick range buttons shown, poor UX
commonMistakes.fix: Add :quick-range-selection-status="true"

valueFormat.notes: V1 used array of unix timestamps [start, end]. V2 uses object with date strings.

migrationFromV1.transformation: { startDate: formatDate(new Date(v1[0] * 1000)), endDate: formatDate(new Date(v1[1] * 1000)) }

commonMistakes.mistake: Using V1 array format
commonMistakes.fix: Convert to object format

valueFormat.notes: Maps locale codes to date format strings. Used for display formatting.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling both string and array formats
commonMistakes.fix: Always check Array.isArray(payload) first

periodSelected.useCase: Triggered when user selects a main period. Use this to recalculate dynamic comparison ranges (e.g., Previous Period Last Year)

comparisonPeriodSelected.useCase: Triggered when user selects a comparison period

payloadTypes.format: { predefinedRange: { start, end }, comparedRange: { start, end } }
payloadTypes.example: { predefinedRange: { start: '01.12.2024', end: '20.12.2024' }, comparedRange: { start: '', end: '' } }

openComparison.useCase: Triggered when comparison toggle is activated

payloadTypes.format: { predefinedRange: { start, end }, comparedRange: { start, end } }
payloadTypes.example: { predefinedRange: { start: '01.12.2024', end: '20.12.2024' }, comparedRange: { start: '', end: '' } }

closeComparison.useCase: Triggered when comparison toggle is deactivated

helperFunctions.name: formatDateToSlash
helperFunctions.description: Convert Date object to mm/dd/yyyy format (required for customRanges)

helperFunctions.name: parseDate
helperFunctions.description: Parse date string from various formats to Date object

helperFunctions.name: convertToLocalFormat
helperFunctions.description: Convert mm/dd/yyyy to locale format (e.g., dd.mm.yyyy for Turkish)

performanceNotes.solution: Use watch with immediate: false instead of computed

performanceNotes.impact: Component doesn't re-render on comparison toggle

accessibilityNotes.reason: Form accessibility and screen reader navigation

examples.title: Basic Date Range Picker
examples.description: Simple date range picker without comparison
examples.code:
<template>
  <InDatePickerV2
    id="date-picker"
    name="date-picker"
    theme="white"
    label-text="Select Period"
    :value="dateValue"
    :min-date="minDate"
    :max-date="maxDate"
    :locale="locale"
    :format-mapping="formatMapping"
    :quick-range-selection-status="true"
    @apply="handleApply" />
</template>

<script>
import { InDatePickerV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InDatePickerV2 },
  
  data() {
    return {
      startDate: '01.12.2024',
      endDate: '20.12.2024',
      minDate: '01.01.2023',
      maxDate: new Date(),
      locale: 'tr-TR',
      formatMapping: {
        'tr-TR': 'dd.mm.yyyy',
        'en-US': 'mm/dd/yyyy',
        'default': 'dd.mm.yyyy'
      }
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    dateValue() {
      return [{
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      }];
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handleApply(payload) {
      // payload is string: "mm/dd/yyyy-mm/dd/yyyy"
      const [start, end] = payload.split('-');
      this.startDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(start);
      this.endDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(end);
    },
    
    convertToLocalFormat(dateStr) {
      // Convert mm/dd/yyyy to dd.mm.yyyy for Turkish locale
      const [month, day, year] = dateStr.split('/');
      return `${day}.${month}.${year}`;
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: With Comparison & Dynamic Ranges
examples.description: Full-featured date picker with comparison mode and dynamically calculated comparison ranges
examples.code:
<template>
  <InDatePickerV2
    :key="`${datePickerKey}-${startDate}-${endDate}`"
    id="date-picker-compare"
    name="date-picker-compare"
    theme="white"
    label-text="Select Period"
    :value="datePickerValue"
    :min-date="minDate"
    :max-date="maxDate"
    :locale="locale"
    :format-mapping="formatMapping"
    :comparison-status="true"
    :disabled-comparison-status="compareDisabled"
    :quick-range-selection-status="true"
    :custom-ranges="customRangesForV2"
    :compared-custom-ranges="comparedCustomRangesForV2"
    @apply="handleApply"
    @periodSelected="handlePeriodSelected"
    @openComparison="handleOpenComparison"
    @closeComparison="handleCloseComparison" />
</template>

<script>
import { InDatePickerV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InDatePickerV2 },
  
  data() {
    return {
      datePickerKey: 0,
      startDate: '01.12.2024',
      endDate: '20.12.2024',
      comparisonStartDate: '',
      comparisonEndDate: '',
      isComparisonActive: false,
      compareDisabled: false,
      comparedCustomRangesForV2: [],
      minDate: '01.01.2023',
      maxDate: new Date(),
      locale: 'tr-TR',
      formatMapping: {
        'tr-TR': 'dd.mm.yyyy',
        'en-US': 'mm/dd/yyyy',
        'default': 'dd.mm.yyyy'
      },
      customDateRanges: {
        'Q4 2024': [new Date('2024-10-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')],
        'Last Quarter': [new Date('2024-07-01'), new Date('2024-09-30')]
      }
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    datePickerValue() {
      const main = {
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      };
      
      if (this.isComparisonActive && this.comparisonStartDate && this.comparisonEndDate) {
        return [
          main,
          {
            startDate: this.comparisonStartDate,
            endDate: this.comparisonEndDate
          }
        ];
      }
      
      return [main];
    },
    
    customRangesForV2() {
      return Object.entries(this.customDateRanges).map(([title, dates], index) => ({
        name: `custom${index + 1}`,
        title,
        startDate: this.formatDateToSlash(dates[0]),
        endDate: this.formatDateToSlash(dates[1])
      }));
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handlePeriodSelected(range) {
      // Recalculate dynamic comparison ranges
      const start = this.parseDate(range.start);
      const end = this.parseDate(range.end);
      const periodLength = Math.floor((end - start) / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24)) + 1;
      
      // Previous Period
      const prevEnd = new Date(start);
      prevEnd.setDate(start.getDate() - 1);
      const prevStart = new Date(prevEnd);
      prevStart.setDate(prevEnd.getDate() - periodLength + 1);
      
      // Previous Period Last Year
      const lastYearStart = new Date(prevStart);
      lastYearStart.setFullYear(prevStart.getFullYear() - 1);
      const lastYearEnd = new Date(prevEnd);
      lastYearEnd.setFullYear(prevEnd.getFullYear() - 1);
      
      this.comparedCustomRangesForV2 = [{
        name: 'lastYear',
        title: 'Previous Period Last Year',
        startDate: this.formatDateToSlash(lastYearStart),
        endDate: this.formatDateToSlash(lastYearEnd)
      }];
    },
    
    handleApply(payload) {
      if (Array.isArray(payload)) {
        // With comparison
        const [mainRange, comparisonRange] = payload;
        this.applyDateRange(mainRange);
        this.applyComparisonRange(comparisonRange);
      } else {
        // Single range
        this.applyDateRange(payload);
      }
    },
    
    applyDateRange(rangeStr) {
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.startDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(start);
      this.endDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(end);
    },
    
    applyComparisonRange(rangeStr) {
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.comparisonStartDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(start);
      this.comparisonEndDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(end);
    },
    
    handleOpenComparison() {
      this.isComparisonActive = true;
    },
    
    handleCloseComparison() {
      this.isComparisonActive = false;
      this.comparisonStartDate = '';
      this.comparisonEndDate = '';
    },
    
    formatDateToSlash(date) {
      const d = new Date(date);
      const month = String(d.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
      const day = String(d.getDate()).padStart(2, '0');
      const year = d.getFullYear();
      return `${month}/${day}/${year}`;
    },
    
    parseDate(dateStr) {
      const parts = dateStr.split(/[/.]/); 
      const isSlash = dateStr.includes('/');
      
      if (isSlash) {
        // mm/dd/yyyy
        const [month, day, year] = parts;
        return new Date(parseInt(year), parseInt(month) - 1, parseInt(day));
      } else {
        // dd.mm.yyyy
        const [day, month, year] = parts;
        return new Date(parseInt(year), parseInt(month) - 1, parseInt(day));
      }
    },
    
    convertToLocalFormat(dateStr) {
      const [month, day, year] = dateStr.split('/');
      return `${day}.${month}.${year}`;
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: Basic Single Select
examples.code:
<template>
  <InSelect
    id="status-select"
    label-text="Status"
    placeholder-text="Select status"
    :options="statusOptions"
    :value="selectedStatus"
    @optionClick="handleSelect" />
</template>

<script>
import { InSelect } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InSelect },
  data() {
    return {
      statusOptions: [
        { text: 'Active', value: 'active' },
        { text: 'Pending', value: 'pending' },
        { text: 'Inactive', value: 'inactive' }
      ],
      selectedStatus: [] // Empty = no selection
    };
  },
  methods: {
    handleSelect(option) {
      this.selectedStatus = [option]; // CRITICAL: Always array!
      console.log('Selected:', option.value);
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: With Search and Icons
examples.code:
<template>
  <InSelect
    id="country-select"
    label-text="Country"
    placeholder-text="Search countries..."
    :search-status="true"
    :options="countryOptions"
    :value="selectedCountry"
    @optionClick="handleSelect"
    @search="handleSearch" />
</template>

<script>
import { InSelect } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InSelect },
  data() {
    return {
      allCountries: [
        { text: 'United States', value: 'US', icon: 'flag-us' },
        { text: 'United Kingdom', value: 'UK', icon: 'flag-uk' },
        { text: 'Turkey', value: 'TR', icon: 'flag-tr' },
        // ... more countries
      ],
      countryOptions: [],
      selectedCountry: []
    };
  },
  created() {
    this.countryOptions = this.allCountries;
  },
  methods: {
    handleSelect(option) {
      this.selectedCountry = [option];
    },
    handleSearch(query) {
      if (!query) {
        this.countryOptions = this.allCountries;
        return;
      }
      this.countryOptions = this.allCountries.filter(country =>
        country.text.toLowerCase().includes(query.toLowerCase())
      );
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: Lazy Loading with Infinite Scroll
examples.description: Load options on scroll for large datasets
examples.code:
<template>
  <InSelect
    id="user-select"
    label-text="Select User"
    :search-status="true"
    :lazy-load="true"
    :lazy-load-search="true"
    :fetch-page="currentPage"
    :options="users"
    :value="selectedUser"
    :loading-state="isLoading"
    @optionClick="handleSelect"
    @search="handleSearch"
    @endScroll="loadMore" />
</template>

<script>
import { InSelect } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InSelect },
  data() {
    return {
      users: [],
      selectedUser: [],
      currentPage: 1,
      isLoading: false,
      searchQuery: ''
    };
  },
  created() {
    this.loadUsers();
  },
  methods: {
    async loadUsers() {
      this.isLoading = true;
      try {
        const response = await fetch(
          `/api/users?page=${this.currentPage}&search=${this.searchQuery}`
        );
        const data = await response.json();
        
        // Transform API response to select format
        const newUsers = data.users.map(u => ({
          text: u.name,
          value: u.id,
          description: u.email
        }));
        
        this.users = [...this.users, ...newUsers];
      } finally {
        this.isLoading = false;
      }
    },
    
    loadMore() {
      this.currentPage++;
      this.loadUsers();
    },
    
    handleSearch(query) {
      this.searchQuery = query;
      this.currentPage = 1;
      this.users = []; // Clear existing
      this.loadUsers();
    },
    
    handleSelect(option) {
      this.selectedUser = [option];
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: Grouped Options
examples.code:
<template>
  <InSelect
    id="product-select"
    label-text="Select Product"

<script>
import { InSelect } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InSelect },
  data() {
    return {
      productOptions: [
        {
          groupLabel: 'Marketing',
          options: [
            { text: 'Email Marketing', value: 'email' },
            { text: 'SMS Marketing', value: 'sms' }
          ]
        },
        {
          groupLabel: 'Analytics',
          options: [
            { text: 'Web Analytics', value: 'web' },
            { text: 'Mobile Analytics', value: 'mobile' }
          ]
        }
      ],
      selectedProduct: []
    };
  },
  methods: {
    handleSelect(option) {
      this.selectedProduct = [option];
    }
  }
};
</script>

InDatePicker-to-V2.description: Migration from InDatePicker (V1) to InDatePickerV2 involves significant prop structure changes, especially for value format and custom ranges. Comparison feature is new in V2.

value.reverseTransformCode:
// V2 to V1
const v1Value = v2Value[0];
value.notes: V1 used plain object, V2 uses array of objects to support comparison mode

customRanges.v2Type: [{ name: string, title: string, startDate: string, endDate: string }]
customRanges.notes: CRITICAL: V1 used object with Date values, V2 uses array with string dates in mm/dd/yyyy format. Property name changed from 'label' to 'title'.

disabledRange.notes: V1 used unix timestamp array, V2 uses date string object

additionalRanges.notes: V1's additionalRanges boolean replaced with V2's defaultRanges array for more control

visibleRange.transformCode:
// V1 to V2
const quickRangeSelectionStatus = v1VisibleRange;

openPosition.transformCode:
// V1 to V2
const calendarPopoverAlign = v1OpenPosition;

@update.payloadChange: V2 can return array when comparison is active: [mainRange, comparisonRange]

newFeaturesInV2.description: Built-in comparison mode allowing users to select two date ranges for side-by-side comparison
Ability to calculate comparison ranges dynamically based on selected main period
newFeaturesInV2.usage: Listen to @periodSelected and update comparedCustomRanges accordingly

newFeaturesInV2.description: More flexible quick range system with array-based configuration
newFeaturesInV2.usage: Use defaultRanges array to control which default ranges appear

newFeaturesInV2.description: Built-in date validation with customizable error messages
newFeaturesInV2.usage: Component automatically validates date inputs and shows errors

helperFunctions.name: formatDateToSlash
helperFunctions.description: Convert Date object to mm/dd/yyyy format (required for V2 customRanges)

helperFunctions.name: formatDate
helperFunctions.description: Convert Date object to locale format (dd.mm.yyyy or mm/dd/yyyy)

helperFunctions.name: parseDate
helperFunctions.description: Parse date string to Date object (handles both slash and dot delimiters)

migrationSteps.title: Convert customRanges to V2 format
migrationSteps.notes: Requires creating computed property and formatDateToSlash helper

migrationSteps.title: Update event handler logic to handle array payload
Add helper functions
migrationSteps.notes: Add formatDateToSlash, formatDate, and parseDate methods

migrationSteps.title: (Optional) Add comparison mode
migrationSteps.notes: If you want to use new comparison feature, add :comparison-status="true" and handle @openComparison/@closeComparison events

InDatePicker-to-V2.fullExampleBefore:
<!-- V1 Implementation -->
<template>
  <InDatePicker
    id="date-picker"
    :value="dateValue"
    :custom-ranges="customRanges"
    :disabled-range="disabledRange"
    :additional-ranges="true"
    :visible-range="true"
    open-position="right"
    @update="handleUpdate" />
</template>

<script>
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      startDate: '01/12/2024',
      endDate: '20/12/2024',
      customRanges: {
        'Q4 2024': [new Date('2024-10-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')]
      },
      disabledRange: [1704067200, 1735689599] // Unix timestamps
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    dateValue() {
      return {
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      };
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handleUpdate(rangeStr) {
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.startDate = start;
      this.endDate = end;
    }
  }
};
</script>
InDatePicker-to-V2.fullExampleAfter:
<!-- V2 Implementation -->
<template>
  <InDatePickerV2
    id="date-picker"
    :value="datePickerValue"
    :custom-ranges="customRangesForV2"
    :disabled-range="disabledRangeForV2"
    :default-ranges="['Today', 'Yesterday', 'Last 7 Days', 'Last 30 Days', 'This Month', 'Last Month']"
    :quick-range-selection-status="true"
    calendar-popover-align="right"
    @apply="handleApply" />
</template>

<script>
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      startDate: '01/12/2024',
      endDate: '20/12/2024',
      customRanges: {
        'Q4 2024': [new Date('2024-10-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')]
      },
      disabledRange: [1704067200, 1735689599]
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    datePickerValue() {
      return [{
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      }];
    },
    
    customRangesForV2() {
      return Object.entries(this.customRanges).map(([title, dates], index) => ({
        name: `custom${index + 1}`,
        title,
        startDate: this.formatDateToSlash(dates[0]),
        endDate: this.formatDateToSlash(dates[1])
      }));
    },
    
    disabledRangeForV2() {
      if (this.disabledRange && this.disabledRange.length === 2) {
        return {
          startDate: this.formatDate(new Date(this.disabledRange[0] * 1000)),
          endDate: this.formatDate(new Date(this.disabledRange[1] * 1000))
        };
      }
      return { startDate: '', endDate: '' };
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handleApply(payload) {
      if (Array.isArray(payload)) {
        const [mainRange, comparisonRange] = payload;
        this.applyMainRange(mainRange);
        this.applyComparisonRange(comparisonRange);
      } else {
        this.applyMainRange(payload);
      }
    },
    
    applyMainRange(rangeStr) {
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.startDate = start;
      this.endDate = end;
    },
    
    applyComparisonRange(rangeStr) {
      // Handle comparison range if needed
    },
    
    formatDateToSlash(date) {
      const d = new Date(date);
      const month = String(d.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
      const day = String(d.getDate()).padStart(2, '0');
      const year = d.getFullYear();
      return `${month}/${day}/${year}`;
    },
    
    formatDate(date) {
      const d = new Date(date);
      const day = String(d.getDate()).padStart(2, '0');
      const month = String(d.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
      const year = d.getFullYear();
      return `${month}/${day}/${year}`;
    }
  }
};
</script>

commonPitfalls.pitfall: Forgetting to wrap value in array
Using wrong date format in customRanges
commonPitfalls.solution: Use mm/dd/yyyy format with formatDateToSlash helper

commonPitfalls.impact: Crashes when comparison mode is used

testingChecklist: @apply event handler works with single range
(If using comparison) @apply event handler works with array
